author: ANI
title: India News | Kerala Climate Activist, Kallur Balan Devotes His Life to Environmental Conservation | LatestLY
text: Kannur (Kerala) [India], July 5 (ANI): Kerala climate activist, Kallur Balan, popularly known as 'green man', for planting and nurturing lakhs of trees along the roadsides has taken up another mission of providing food and water to wild animals and birds. There is no denying that the man from the Kallur region of the Palakkad district of Kerela has devoted his whole life to the forest and its animals in that region. Velu Balakrishnan, also known as the 'Kallur Balan', even at the age of 74, is still doing his duty in serving the forest and its animals as his own. Also Read | Karnataka Shocker: Baby Dies Due to Genital Injury During Caesarean in Davanagre District; Family Protests Against Doctor. Every day, Balan collects 500 kg of fruits and vegetables to satisfy the hunger of the animals in the forest. After completing his morning routine, where he climbs the mountain and does yoga, Balan leaves with his Jeep to collect fruits by six o'clock in the morning. After travelling for around fifty kilometres, Balan returns with the fruits around eight o'clock. Also Read | Stock Market Today: Nifty Scales New Lifetime High; Sensex Retreats From Record To Slip Below 80,000. He distributes the fruits in the Aiyarmala, Kinavallur, Vazhukappara, Mundur, Dhonimala and Walayar areas of the forest, feeds the birds and animals, and also plants saplings. Animals ranging from monkeys, hares, and peacocks to wild boars came out of the forest as soon as they heard the sound of Balan's jeep. Wholesalers from markets in Palakkad to Ottapalam provide Balan with apples, pomegranates, oranges, guavas, bananas, watermelons, jackfruits, and many vegetables, which are edible even if they start to spoil, free of charge to feed the animals. Many acquaintances will also give him money to fuel the jeep. This has been his lifestyle since 2000 and it hasn't changed at all. Over the last 24 years, Balan has spent every day of his life planting and nurturing over 30 lakh tree saplings, which have now grown into magnificent, full-grown trees. He has also planted thousands of trees alongside highways and other public spaces, helping to restore nature's beauty in that region, which was once as dry as a desert. In Arangat, Balan is a Balettan (elder brother) to the locals. (ANI) (This is an unedited and auto-generated story from Syndicated News feed, LatestLY Staff may not have modified or edited the content body)

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Michael And Nicole Swanson Charged With Sexual Abuse: DA
text:
By Mac Bullock ,
1 hour ago Michael Swanson; Nicole Swanson Photo Credit: Delaware County District Attorney's Office Michael and Nicole Swanson are charged with rape, involuntary deviate sexual assault, aggravated indecent sexual assault of a person with a mental disability, and related counts, according to court records and prosecutors.
Authorities said the victims, aged 27 and 30, were friends from a special education program at Chichester High School. The 27-year-old victim, who was then pregnant with Michael Swanson's child, introduced the 30-year-old victim to him, according to the DA's Office.
"The three of them entered into a sexual relationship," prosecutors said in the release.
Michael Swanson convinced the 30-year-old victim to move in with him and Nicole Swanson to a house in Broomall, investigators said.
In February 2023, when the 27-year-old victim gave birth to Swanson's child, Riddle Hospital staff made a report to authorities "due to (victim's) disability and due to Michael Swanson’s numerous previous cases with social services," officials said.
Months later in July, the Swansons and both victims moved to a trailer in Tallahassee, Florida, according to the release.
"A witness informed investigators that the reason Michael Swanson moved to Florida was that he was concerned about social services looking into his involvement with (victim) and her child," the DA's Office said.
In Florida, authorities said Nicole Swanson, a woman named Caitlyn Eusden, and Swanson's children recorded a video in which they beat the 30-year-old victim. The recording was sent to the victim's family, and they were "able to locate (her) and remove her from the situation."
In an interview with investigators, the 30-year-old victim said she was "sexually assaulted by Michael Swanson approximately two times per day," according to prosecutors. He also took away her cell phone, food card, checks, money, and insurance card," and made himself the beneficiary of her Social Security payouts, authorities said.
Michael Swanson was extradited to Pennsylvania after the police interview, prosecutors said.
The 27-year-old victim also told investigators that Michael Swanson sexually abused her, recorded the abuse, and took away her cell phone, the DA's Office said. She and her child have since been removed from the home and are living with family in South Carolina, according to the release.
“It is difficult to comprehend the truly heinous actions of these defendants. The defendants knowingly exploited two intellectually disabled young women. They used them for their sexual gratification, and stole their benefits," said DA Jack Stollsteimer.
"They attempted to hide their conduct by cutting off contact with the victims’ families, and went so far as to remove the women to Florida to evade detection."
"Defendant Michael Swanson impregnated one of the victims and brought a child into this vile situation – joining seven other children fathered by Swanson."
"The members of law enforcement, the medical professionals, and the social workers who have worked on this case stand united in calling out the depravity of these defendants’ actions," Stollsteimer said.
"They will be prosecuted to the fullest extent of the law."
Michael and Nicole Swanson are being held on $900,000 and $1 million bail respectively, court records show. Each has a hearing before Magisterial District Judge Andrew Goldberg scheduled for May 2.

author: 每日经济新闻
title: 同兴达：大疆是公司重要客户，合作主要在光学摄像头业务领域中 _ 东方财富网
text:
每经AI快讯，有投资者在投资者互动平台提问：公司与大疆具体在哪方面的产品上有合作？ 无人机 ，车载，运动相机上的镜头模组都有合作吗，还是其他的方面也有？
　　 同兴达 （002845.SZ）7月31日在投资者互动平台表示，大疆公司一直是我司重要客户，合作主要在光学摄像头业务领域中，具体合作项目因涉及商业机密，暂不便透露，敬请谅解。
（文章来源：每日经济新闻）
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->products and services

author: Vittorio Sgarbi
title: Eugenio Riccomini, angelo della critica - ilGiornale.it
text:
Il funerale dello storico dell’arte Eugenio Riccomini, morto a Bologna a 87 anni il giorno di Natale, si terrà oggi nel capoluogo emiliano-romagnolo. La camera ardente sarà allestita dalle 10 alle 17,30 nella sala dello Stabat Mater dell’Archiginnasio, in piazza Galvani 1. Era un maestro. E aveva capito, oltre all’arte, la vita. Per questo non aveva bisogno di una cattedra, dello spazio di un’aula o di un teatro, dove pure raccontò il suo sogno dell’arte. Voleva stare davanti ai quadri, alle sculture, in quel corpo a corpo che consente il lavoro privilegiato del Sovrintendente. E quei corpi, quelle tele, quelle tavole, quelle terrecotte, quei gessi, quei marmi erano come persone, amici, compagni, parenti. Con cui parlare e di cui parlare.
Questa era la condizione ideale e naturale di Eugenio Riccomini. Parlarti di loro davanti a loro. Passeggiare, entrare nelle chiese di Venezia, di Bologna, di Ferrara, di Parma, accompagnato da un collega, un compagno, un figlio. Questo rapporto confidenziale, affettivo e affettuoso con le opere d’arte era la sua vita. Stare su un’impalcatura davanti al Giudizio Universale della Cattedrale di Ferrara. Non aveva allievi, ma amici, compagni occasionali di lavoro odi missioni, sopralluoghi in cantieri o nei laboratori dei restauratori. Eugenio arrivava da Ottorino (Nonfarmale, il restauratore), ed era festa. Io l’avevo intravisto negli anni dell’Università con Francesco Arcangeli nell’Istituto di storia dell’arte, dove mi sarei come lui laureato con Carlo Volpe, e dove stavano studiose devote come Vera Pietrantoni Fortunato, Anna Maria Matteucci, Daniela Scaglietti, Nora Clerici Bagozzi, Mara Angela.
C’era molta concentrazione ma quando arrivava lui era felicità. Bastava l’immancabile farfalla per allontanare la polvere, ed erano il suo gioco, il suo divertimento, il suo sorriso a restituire alla vita le pagine dei libri. Così diverso, così libero, lo ritrovai, poco dopo la laurea, superiore collega a Parma, mentre io entravo come ispettore nella città da cui lui era partito, Venezia. Era appena morto Arcangeli, e in quei tempi era difficile muoversi lievi in quel mondo così severo. A lui e a me fu concesso.
Il vero incontro, dopo Bologna e Venezia, fu a Parma, quando un istituto bancario ci volle insieme a presentare un suo libro, dal titolo insolito e nel luogo più insolito. Nel Duomo di Parma e sotto la cupola, per lui «la più bella di tutte». Fu un duetto, un duello, il gioco di due narcisi, nella situazione più aulica per gareggiare. Era il 1980, Parma era la città più allegra e più ricca dell’Emilia. Correggio il pittore più sensuale e più erotico. Eugenio ed io, due seduttori. Lui a 44 anni, io a 28. Irresistibili, ma non rivali. Complici e così lontani dallo stesso mondo da cui venivamo e a cui appartenevamo.
Così nacque un’amicizia, nella luce del cielo di Correggio. Il cielo era stato generoso con lui, destinandolo a una città che gli assomigliava, dove si era formato. Ed era la città di Attilio e Bernardo Bertolucci, di Luigi Magnani, di Mario Lanfranchi, di Roberto Tassi, di Franco Maria Ricci. E a Parma Riccomini per primo inventò ciò che sarebbe stato ripetuto da altri: un cantiere aperto con i ponteggi percorribili per vedere da vicino, toccare gli affreschi di Correggio. Fu, per la prima volta, come salire in paradiso, con un’intuizione da astronauta dell’arte.
Il suo piacere era la conoscenza, ciò che per gli altri era mistero, per lui era luce. Così, dopo Longhi, dopo Arcangeli, egli vide un’altra Bologna. C’era ancora da scoprire, dopo il passaggio di quei maestri, ed è quello che lui chiamò «ordine e vaghezza» e poi «vaghezza e furore», il trionfo della scultura barocca nei palazzi e nelle chiese della città. Dare certa identità a ciò che c’era, che andava guardato con occhi nuovi.
Questo fu il suo pensiero dominante, il suo desiderio, il suo divertimento. Esplorare mondi presenti ma sconosciuti. La vaghezza chiedeva furore. E lo ebbe a ritmo di musica come tutta la vita mozartiana di Riccomini.
Ma il pioniere, lo scopritore, il filologo non ha mai prevalso sull’uomo, felice degli incontri, delle scoperte, delle opere ritrovate. Ne mise in fila, con una voluttà maestosa e senza precedenti, 3300, molte inedite, per la grande e rivelatrice mostra sul Settecento in Emilia e Romagna, in cinque sezioni, di cui tre a Bologna, una a Parma e una, di carattere neoclassico, nel palazzo Milzetti di Faenza, da poco divenuto di proprietà statale. Tanto basterebbe, con le imprese ferraresi, per una gloria imperitura. In Paradiso racconterà l’arte a Dio.

author: WND News Services
title: RNC resolution condemns Biden's border crisis, cites Chinese 'sabotage risk'
text:
Philip Lenczycki
Daily Caller News Foundation
Advertisement - story continues below
The Republican National Committee (RNC) adopted a resolution condemning the Biden administration’s immigration policies Thursday, citing the national security threat posed by “Chinese military-aged men” entering the country illegally, the Daily Caller News Foundation has learned.
The new RNC resolution states that the Biden administration “deliberately” invited in a “massive and systematic illegal alien invasion of the U.S.,” which, among other things, has exposed the nation to an “exceedingly high” sabotage risk “with the rise of Chinese immigrant encounters.” Co-sponsored by 48 RNC members from 23 states, the resolution calls for enabling state and local law enforcement to arrest and detain certain illegal immigrants until U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) assumes custody.
TRENDING:
No woke! Governor signs bill banning DEI programs
Get the hottest, most important news stories on the Internet – delivered FREE to your inbox as soon as they break! Take just 30 seconds and sign up for WND's Email News Alerts!
The Biden administration drastically simplified the vetting process for Chinese illegal immigrants in April 2023, the DCNF previously
reported after obtaining an internal U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) email. The new CBP guidance radically reduced the number of interview questions for Chinese illegal immigrants from roughly 40 to just five.
Advertisement - story continues below
Border Patrol agents have encountered approximately 35,000 Chinese illegal immigrants at the border since 2022,
according to CBP data.
“President Biden’s border crisis has exposed the U.S. to ‘exceedingly high’ sabotage risk with the rise of Chinese alien encounters,” the resolution states, quoting author Gordon Chang. “Some of the Chinese illegal aliens have been instructed in Chinese how to fake their political asylum evidence after they entered the U.S.”
The RNC resolution also criticizes the Biden administration for ending former President Donald Trump’s so-called “
remain in Mexico” policy, which required illegal immigrants to wait in Mexico while their immigration cases moved through U.S. courts. The resolution also faults Biden for reinstating the so-called “catch and release” policy, which refers to a 2021 Department of Homeland Security memorandum authorizing immigration officials who encounter illegal immigrants to utilize “alternatives to detention,” such as “electronic monitoring via a GPS-enabled ankle bracelet.”
Consequently, the new RNC resolution supports
H.R. 2, the Secure the Border Act of 2023, on the grounds that it will “stop this invasion of the U.S. by finishing the wall, ending the ‘catch and release’ program, ending the abuse of parole authority, ending the manipulation of the asylum system and reinstating ‘remain in Mexico’ policy, which protects American jobs and taxpayers by barring asylum seekers from living and working in the U.S. until their claims are approved.”
“The Republican National Committee supports immediate deportation of illegal immigrant asylum applicants ordered removed upon failure to appear at their court hearings,” the new RNC resolution states. “A lawless border facilitates unspeakable human suffering through criminal cartel sponsored human trafficking leading to slavery and sexual abuse, including abuse of children.”
Advertisement - story continues below
Solomon Yue, who has served as an Oregon RNC committeeman since 2000, was the chief sponsor of the new RNC resolution.
Born in China, Yue came to the U.S. in 1980 to study at Alaska Pacific University and became a naturalized American citizen in 1992, he told the DCNF.
“As a legal immigrant from Communist China, I am concerned about Biden’s eight million illegal alien invasion of America,” Yue said. “I don’t want to see this republic become the country I have escaped. When that happens, we’ll have no place to go.”
Yue told the DCNF that he believes that the spike in “Chinese military-aged men” illegally entering the U.S. is “a national security threat.”
Advertisement - story continues below
“The CCP is exploiting the current illegal alien invasion of the U.S. by sending their fifth columnists as fake asylum seekers,” Yue said.
This story originally was published by
the Daily Caller News Foundation.

author: Michael Popke
title: PwC to lay off 2.4% of their workforce in October
text: For the first time in 15 years, accounting giant PricewaterhouseCoopers's U.S. unit announced on Sept. 11 formal layoffs that will impact about 1,800 workers in the United States and offshore — or about 2.4% of its 75,000 employees . As The Wall Street Journal reports , the move comes as the firm restructures its technology group in the wake of slowing demand for some of its advisory business. author: visao.sapo.pt
title: O “Tom & Jerry” tinha razão: Os ratos são mestres do engano – Green Savers
text:
O “Tom & Jerry” tinha razão: Os ratos são mestres do engano Por Green Savers 14:00 - 5 Julho 2024 @momokacma (CC BY 2.0)
Partilhar “Apanha-me se conseguires”: os ratos que vivem em liberdade apresentam um comportamento de evasão altamente flexível, sugestivo de engano tático intencional.
O emprego de uma tática para enganar intencionalmente outro animal, é um comportamento complexo baseado numa cognição de ordem superior, que raramente foi documentado fora dos primatas e dos corvídeos.
Utilizando câmaras de teste de estilo laboratorial colocadas perto de uma floresta nos arredores de Varsóvia, os investigadores descobriram que os ratos de riscas pretas que vivem em liberdade demonstram um comportamento de esquiva enganadora.
Os ratos perseguidos escondiam-se junto à entrada da câmara até que o perseguidor entrasse e depois fugiam de novo pela entrada quando o perseguidor estava de costas. Este comportamento foi registado 21 vezes e é a primeira prova de engano tático intencional em ratos.
Sendo a primeira prova de um comportamento sugestivo de engano tático entre ratos, esta descoberta pode ser relevante para a intencionalidade não-humana e para a teoria da mente.
Continuar a ler
Partilhar
